initialFiles.content:
# Challenge: Specific vs General Requests

Learn the difference between vague and specific prompts.

## Objectives
1. Complete Task A with a VAGUE prompt (see what happens)
2. Complete Task B with a SPECIFIC prompt (better results!)
3. Document what you learned in notes.md

objectives.description: Create notes.md documenting what you learned
Notes discuss specific vs general prompts

hints.text: Try both approaches and compare the results. Which gives you more control?
For task-a, try 'improve this'. For task-b, try 'rename to doublePositiveNumbers, use const, convert to filter().map()'
Complete both tasks, then create notes.md explaining how specific prompts give you more predictable, controlled results.

solution.approach: Compare vague vs specific prompts, then document the difference.
solution.example: Refactor both files and document your learnings about prompt specificity
alternativeApproaches: Try multiple vague prompts to see variation in results
Be very specific about naming, style, and patterns

learningPoints: Specific prompts give predictable, controlled results
Vague prompts may give good results but are less controllable
Include details: names, patterns, style preferences
